title: stuck in stage 2/15 headers
body:
This should only be used in very rare cases e.g. if you are not 100% sure if something is a bug or asking a question that leads to improving the documentation. For general questions please use [Erigon's discord](https://discord.gg/hQ2dxbNZ).
version  is erigon version 2.36.0-dev-3aec07f4
my flag `./build/bin/erigon --datadir=data --chain=mainnet --port=30303 --http.port=8545 --authrpc.port=8551 --torrent.port=42069 --private.api.addr=127.0.0.1:9090 --http --ws --http.api=eth,debug,net,trace,web3,erigon -authrpc.jwtsecret ./data/jwt.hex --externalcl`
the log like this, please tell me what's wrong with my client.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61180702/216901949-f08c6883-90da-43df-b74b-383473453777.png)
and this is consensus client Prysm log
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61180702/216902719-f80fddd3-795c-4c16-b3b6-8240d57d6dec.png)
You should update to the latest Erigon version (I recommend 2.37.0 because 2.38.0 seems to have a pretty severe bug), but I don't see anything wrong in the logs you posted.

me tooooo. stuck in stage 2/15 headers.
/home/ubuntu/erigon/bin/erigon --datadir=/opt/bscdata/erigon --chain=bsc --prune=hrtc  --http.addr=0.0.0.0 --authrpc.vhosts=* --http.corsdomain * --http.vhosts * --db.pagesize=16k --torrent.download.slots 7 --torrent.download.rate=512mb --torrent.upload.rate=20mb --private.api.addr=0.0.0.0:9090  --pprof --pprof.addr=0.0.0.0 --pprof.port=9351 --http.api eth,erigon,web3,net,debug,trace,txpool
Does v2.38 solve the issue and "escape" from the loop of an existing v2.36 datadir? Or do we need to start the sync with v2.38 from beginning?

> Does v2.38 solve the issue and "escape" from the loop of an existing v2.36 datadir? Or do we need to start the sync with v2.38 from beginning?

In my case the problem was solved after updating to 2.37.0

> Does v2.38 solve the issue and "escape" from the loop of an existing v2.36 datadir? Or do we need to start the sync with v2.38 from beginning?
It did not work in my case, I have stop it for several days and I will try again.
I updated to v2.39 and this issue has been solved

Im running 2.43 and have the exactly same issue

```
datadir : '/data/.erigon/db'
ethash.dagdir: '/data/.erigon/ethash'
prune: "h"
chain : "mainnet"
http.api : ["eth","debug","net", "admin", "trace", "web3", "txpool", "parity"]
p2p.allowed-ports:  11333, 11334, 11335, 11336, 11337
nat: any
http : true
http.port: 8545
http.addr: 0.0.0.0
```
```

--
```
